intro: Badiera diversifolia, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and clusters of showy, tubular flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value. It prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive. Badiera diversifolia is known for its ability to bloom year-round under optimal conditions.
